III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/26/23, Staff 2 slammed the door on Youth A’s finger during
a lock down. The door cut the tip of the youth's finger off and
youth was transported to the emergency room where the fingertip
was sewn back on. It is unknown if it will remain viable.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
01/03/2024.
Interviews:
I contacted complainant via telephone on 01/03/2024, no
additional information was provided.
I interviewed Manager at the facility on 01/03/2024. Manager is the
facility’s certified restraint instructor, and they use the Crisis
Prevention Institute’s Nonviolent Physical Crisis Intervention
model (CPI). He reported on 12/26/2023 Youth A was agitated
because him and Youth B had been going back and forth earlier in
the evening. Staff moved Youth A and Youth C to a classroom with
Staff 3 until around 9:30 pm. Youth A came back on the pod and was
told to go to his room. Youth A went to his room willing, but when
Staff 2 closed the door, Youth A stuck his finger in the door and his
finger was injured. Youth A was taken to the hospital and his finger
was sutured. The Manager was not onsite when this incident
occurred, but the incident was reviewed and discussed. He
reviewed video footage of the incident and Youth A was observed
walking into his room willingly without staff assistance.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 01/03/2024. Youth A has been
at the facility for one month. Youth A’s hand was observed, and his
middle finger was wrapped with dressing and a splinter. Youth A
reported he injured his finger last week by sticking his finger in the
door to jam the locks when staff closed his bedroom door. He
reported Staff 1 pushed him in his room, he then stuck his finger in
the door, trying to jam the door, and that’s when staff slammed the
door on his finger. Youth A could not recall which staff member
closed the door. Youth A said there were several staff members on
the pod, Staff 2 opened the door immediately and Staff 3 wrapped his
finger and called EMS. His finger was stitched, x-rayed, and wrapped.
He denied having any discomfort or being in pain.
2

I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 01/03/2024. Staff 1 is a Coach
Counselor and has been working at the facility for two months. Staff 1
has completed all training including CPI. Staff 1 reported on 12/26/23,
Youth A returned to the pod around 9:30 pm. Youth A was told it was
time to turn in and needed to go to his room, Youth A walked into his
room and a few minutes later walked out. Youth A was redirected to
go back to his room, but he was agitated because of an earlier
incident with Youth B. He and Staff 2 talked with Youth A and
convinced him to go back to his room. Youth A walked back to his
room, sat on his bed, he and Staff 2 walked out of the room and Staff
2 closed the door. He heard Youth A yell after they closed the door,
so they opened the door and saw Youth A had injured his finger.
They immediately attended to Youth A’s hand and Youth A was taken
to the hospital. He denied pushing Youth A or physically managing
Youth A. He said Youth A walked into his room without any
assistance.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 01/03/2024. Staff 2 has been
working at the facility for two months. Staff 2 reported on 12/26/2023
Youth A was escalated because of an earlier incident with another
Youth B. Youth A was told it was time to go to his room, but he
refused. He and Staff 1 verbally redirected Youth A and after a few
minutes, Youth A walked back to his room. Youth A sat on his bed
and Staff 2 and Staff 1 walked out of the bedroom and closed the
door. He denied seeing Youth A stick his finger in the door and
denied staff physically managed Youth A. He said Youth A walked
into his room willingly. Staff 2 said Youth A told him after the incident
that he stuck his finger in the door to jam the lock, because Youth A
did this at his previous placement.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 01/03/2024. Staff 3 reported he
got to the unit right when Staff 2 closed Youth A’s door. He heard
Youth A say his finger was bleeding and Staff 2 immediately opened
the door. Staff 3 grabbed the first aid kit and wrapped Youth A’s finger
until EMS arrived and transported Youth A to the hospital.
I spoke with Youth A’s JJ Worker via telephone on 01/09/2024. JJ
Worker reported the agency communicates well and provides
updates on Youth A’s behavior. She said Youth A has a lot of
anger issues and has assaulted staff and other residents since
placement at the facility. She expressed no concerns regarding
the facility or staff.
3

Video Footage Reviewed:
Video footage from 12/26/2023 at approximately 9:25 pm was
reviewed (Note: there is no audio). Youth B is viewed walking to
his room, there was one staff following behind him and another
staff walking besides him. Youth A goes into his room and a few
seconds later, walks out of his room. Youth A walks around the
pod for a couple minutes with staff members appearing to be
talking to him. Youth A walks back to his room and two staff
members stand in the doorway for a few seconds and then they
close the bedroom door.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/26/2023 completed by Staff 1.
Report was consistent with Staff 1 and Staff 2’s interview
and the Manager’s report.
• Medical report from McLaren Macomb Hospital dated
12/26/2023. Youth A’s left middle finger was treated for
partial traumatic amputation. Treatment: Youth A’s finger
was x-rayed and sutured, applied dressing and splint.
• Staff 1 and Staff 2 do not have disciplinary action in their
personnel file.
• Daily Schedule: Bedtime is at 9:15pm.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and video footage reviewed, no
violation is found. Youth A admitted he stuck his finger in the door
to jam the lock, staff did not see Youth A stick his finger in the
door prior to closing the door.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
